org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.crypto
Class PasswordBasedEncryptionProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.iostream.EncodingAwareObject
      org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.iostream.EncodingAwareComponent
          org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.crypto.EncryptionProcessor
              org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.crypto.PasswordBasedEncryptionProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class PasswordBasedEncryptionProcessor
extends EncryptionProcessor

Uses PBE (Password Based Encyrption) to encyrpt and decrypt data. Must be configured with a password, the algorithm defaults to DEFAULT_ALGORITHM. refer to base class for other behaviour.

Author:
perryj

setPassword

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Description copied from interface: IDataProcessor
This method checks that the current state of an implementation is "meaningful". Implementations of IDataProcessor are typically beans with zero-arg constructors. Implementations are encouraged to add exception to the list parameter rather than throwing them. This allows the calling code to collate the exceptions. If the implementation is an IComponent then the exceptions should be a ValidationException.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class EncryptionProcessor
